title: Automation.com - All Industrial Automation News and Products

items.title: Festo Products Considered Critical Infrastructure
items.summary:
- The **Cybersecurity & Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA)** recognizes Festo products as critical infrastructure in the U.S. 
- Festo developed a **Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT)** to address vulnerabilities and enhance product security. 
- The company aims for compliance with the **EU Cyber Resilience Act** by 2027, ensuring secure development and incident reporting practices.

items.title: Schneider Electric Announces U.S. Winners of Sustainability Awards
items.summary:
- Schneider Electric announced the U.S. winners of its *third annual* **Sustainability Impact Awards** recognizing achievements in efficiency and innovation.
- The awards honored organizations like **Compass Data Centers**, **Equinix**, **Lenovo**, and **The New Terminal One at JFK** for their sustainable initiatives and technological advancements.
- Winning organizations will receive support for their sustainability goals and co-marketing materials as recognition of their contributions.

items.title: AI Adoption Surges in Life Sciences Manufacturing
items.author: Rockwell Automation
items.summary:
- *95% of life sciences manufacturers* are using or evaluating smart technology, driven by pressures to improve efficiency and quality.
- **AI's primary applications** include enhancing product quality (53%), streamlining operations (50%), and strengthening cybersecurity (48%).
- The sector is grappling with a *skilled labor shortage*, with 26% citing it as the top growth barrier, leading many to leverage AI and automation for workforce support.

items.title: Registration Opens for ISA's Automation Summit and Expo
items.summary:
- *Registration is now open* for the Automation Summit and Expo, scheduled for 5 to 9 October 2025.
- The event will include *workshops*, *technical sessions*, and an *expo*, featuring exclusive training opportunities.
- Attendees can also look forward to the *ISA awards gala*, honoring outstanding automation professionals.

items.title: Motion Industries Opens New Branch in Quebec
items.summary:
- Motion Industries, Inc. has opened a new sales branch in *Val-d'Or, Quebec*, enhancing its service capabilities in Northern Quebec.
- The branch, which officially opened on June 2, 2025, is part of a network of approximately 70 locations across Canada, offering extensive *product and engineering services*.
- This initiative aims to create *local job opportunities* and drive economic growth in the region by providing faster service and fostering community relationships.

items.title: FLIR Thermal Vision Protects Ireland’s Electricity Grid
items.summary:
- FLIR's thermal monitoring system enhances *early fire detection* for Ireland's power grid, protecting 25% of its electricity supply.
- By providing immediate alerts, the system prevents cascade failures that could disrupt the grid during peak demands.
- This innovative solution paves the way for safer, more reliable energy infrastructure amid the transition to *renewable energy*.

items.title: Why Your Company Should Shift to Digital Logging
items.author: Asmar Atif
items.summary:
- *Digital logging* enhances operational efficiency by reducing errors and improving data accessibility.
- Transitioning from paper logs improves compliance and audit processes while ensuring accurate record-keeping.
- Overall, digital solutions foster better communication across shifts and turn data into valuable insights for long-term planning.

items.title: SJE Celebrates 50 Years of Innovation and Impact
items.summary:
- **SJE** celebrates 50 years of *innovation*, showcasing its legacy in control solutions.
- Founded in 1975, SJE has become a global leader with over *800 employees*, numerous patents, and multiple brands.
- Looking forward, SJE aims to expand its global impact while continuing to focus on *sustainable water solutions*.

items.title: Dacke Industri Expands in Europe Through Strategic UK Acquisition
items.summary:
- Dacke Industri has acquired an *80% share* in BTL-UK Ltd, strengthening its presence in Europe. 
- The acquisition enhances collaboration within their *Fluid Power Technology Division*, focusing on customer needs. 
- BTL-UK Ltd is a leading manufacturer of *bearings* and *mechanical components*, serving diverse industries globally.

items.title: Siemens and Microsoft Collaborate on IoT for Buildings
items.summary:
- Siemens announces a partnership with Microsoft to enhance **IoT interoperability** for buildings using **Azure IoT Operations**.
- The integration aims to reduce efforts by up to **80%**, enabling better data accessibility and sustainability for large enterprise customers.
- This collaboration emphasizes **open standards** for IoT, paving the way for improved **data-driven insights** in building management.

items.title: Mouser Electronics New Product Insider: Q2 2025 Highlights
items.summary:
- Mouser Electronics has launched over **15,000 new parts** in Q2 2025, including significant **semiconductor** and **AI** components.
- Notable new products include **ROHM microcontrollers**, **AI cameras** from **Seeed Studio**, and **STMicroelectronics' IMU** for advanced sensing applications.
- Mouser emphasizes its commitment to offering *100% certified, genuine products* and extensive technical resources for customers.

items.title: Remote Operations Need Peak-Performance Batteries
items.author: Sol Jacobs
items.summary:
- Industrial applications require specialized *batteries* for extreme environments and remote locations.
- Selecting the right battery involves detailed understanding of *power requirements* and environmental challenges.
- Expertise from a qualified applications engineer can enhance battery longevity and reliability, maximizing *return on investment*.

items.title: Topical Roundup: June 2025
items.author: Melissa Landon
items.summary:
- The article outlines major advancements in *automation* and the relevance of technologies like *IIoT* and *digital twins* in modern industries.
- Highlights include the importance of *Automated Test Equipment* in electronics and the future of *software-defined automation*.
- Additionally, it discusses strategies for *skills development* and *equipment management* in an evolving workforce landscape.

items.title: Siemens Opens One of Europe’s Most Modern Train Factories
items.summary:
- Siemens has inaugurated a €250 million expanded train factory in Munich-Allach, reinforcing its commitment to innovation in Germany.
- The facility will create over 500 jobs and aims to manufacture up to 385 Vectron locomotives and 180 passenger cars annually.
- Significant upgrades include enhanced service capabilities and the integration of AI and robotics, positioning Munich-Allach as a global competence center for rail vehicles.

items.title: Peak Technologies Appoints Michael Wills as CRO
items.summary:
- *Michael Wills* has been appointed as the **Chief Revenue Officer** for North America at Peak Technologies.
- His role focuses on overseeing sales, account management, and marketing operations to drive *scalable growth* and strengthen customer relationships.
- Wills brings over **20 years of experience**, emphasizing customer-focused strategies and innovative solutions to enhance Peak's market presence.

items.title: POSITAL Explosion-Proof Rotary Encoders Now UL Certified
items.summary:
- POSITAL’s IXARC rotary encoders are now UL certified for hazardous environments, suitable for industries like oil and gas and chemical plants.
- These devices are designed with robust materials to prevent ignition and maintain performance under extreme conditions, with a wide range of configurations available.
- The encoders also meet international ATEX and IECEx standards, ensuring compliance for safety in explosive atmospheres.

items.title: ABB Partners with Paragon for U.S. Nuclear Power Solutions
items.summary:
- ABB has signed a *Memorandum of Understanding* with Paragon Energy to develop integrated solutions for the *U.S. nuclear power sector*. 
- The collaboration will focus on both *critical and non-critical areas* of nuclear facilities, enhancing *operational efficiency* and *cyber security*. 
- This initiative responds to the growing *energy demands* in the U.S., especially in sectors like data centers, supported by a $900 million funding initiative for small modular reactors (SMRs).

items.title: The Rise of Collaborative Robots: Technical and Commercial Insights
items.summary:
- Collaborative robots (*cobots*) are set to grow from **$1.2 billion** in 2023 to **$29.8 billion** by 2035. 
- Key sectors like automotive, electronics, and healthcare are driving the adoption of cobots, estimated to reach **73,000 units shipped** globally in 2025.
- Innovations in *machine vision* and *AI* are vital for enhancing cobot performance, achieving over **95% accuracy** in tasks and reducing operational downtime by **25%**.

items.title: How to Get Maximum Value from Your MES
items.author: Nikhil Makhija
items.summary:
- Implementing a *Manufacturing Execution System (MES)* requires careful planning and alignment with *corporate objectives*. 
- Selecting the right *MES software* is crucial for success, necessitating a detailed assessment of vendors and their capabilities. 
- Common pitfalls include *poor communication*, *resistance to change*, and *lack of proper planning*, which can hinder effective implementation.

items.title: Siemens Completes Acquisition of ebm-papst Drive
items.summary:
- Siemens has successfully acquired *ebm-papst's Industrial Drive Technology (IDT)* division, enhancing its automation portfolio.
- The acquisition includes around 650 employees and aims to improve *flexible manufacturing solutions* and support sustainability goals.
- This move is part of Siemens' strategy to connect *digital and real-world technologies*, facilitating innovative manufacturing processes.

items.title: Tools for More Secure OT Environments
items.author: Renee Bassett
items.summary:
- The *2025 ISA OT Cybersecurity Summit* emphasized cross-training between OT and IT security teams to mitigate emerging cybersecurity threats.
- Keynote speaker *John Fitzpatrick* highlighted the need for effective detection and adaptation strategies to secure critical infrastructure.
- The new *ISASecure ACSSA certification* aims to standardize compliance for industrial automation, addressing gaps in security and regulatory concerns.

items.title: Renishaw and IMR Advance Aerospace Optics Manufacturing
items.summary:
- *Renishaw* collaborates with Irish Manufacturing Research (IMR) to enhance *additive manufacturing* for aerospace optics.  
- The project focuses on developing process parameters for metal 3D printing of optical components, shifting from traditional machining to *near-net-shape AM*.  
- This partnership aims to improve production scalability, potentially increasing output from single digits to hundreds or thousands by 2026.

items.title: NEMA Applauds Master Control Systems on Make It American Program Certification
BW Converting’s Machine Learning Project Selected for New Microsoft AI Co-Innovation Lab in Milwaukee
items.summary:
- BW Converting’s project on fault anomalies has been selected for the *Microsoft AI Co-Innovation Lab*.
- The initiative aims to enhance productivity by pairing real-time data with expert analysis through the *Accelerate* platform.
- Collaboration with *TitletownTech* facilitates innovation and strategic development within Wisconsin's tech ecosystem.

items.title: Sustainable Wireless Power Solutions Combat IoT Battery Waste
items.summary:
- The rapid growth of *IoT devices* is leading to a *significant battery waste crisis*, with projections of 78 million unwanted batteries daily by late 2025.
- Powercast aims to combat this by developing *wireless power solutions* that eliminate the need for disposable batteries, thus reducing both e-waste and operational costs.
- With growing support from the industry and government, transitioning to energy-harvesting technologies is seen as vital for a sustainable *IoT future*.

items.title: How Artificial Intelligence is Transforming Manufacturing
items.author: Dr. Matthias Loskyll
items.summary:
- AI is critical for enhancing productivity and efficiency in *manufacturing*. 
- Innovations like *visual quality control* and *predictive maintenance* are transforming traditional practices. 
- The *Industrial AI Suite* enables seamless integration of AI systems to enhance operations across various industries.

items.title: Unlocking Smarter Manufacturing
items.author: Gregory Tink
items.summary:
- *Digital transformation* in manufacturing focuses on integrating **people**, **data**, and **technology** for enhanced efficiency.
- Successful transitions must balance **cultural readiness** with tech adoption to avoid falling into *pilot purgatory*.
- A structured approach with a focus on **evaluation**, **digitization**, and **scaling** is crucial for achieving long-term operational resilience.
